meanings.definition: Next to or beside someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The cat sat alongside the dog.
meanings.sent2: The book was placed alongside the lamp on the table.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel danced alongside the tree, pretending to be a leaf.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter bubbled up alongside the tinkling of wind chimes.
meanings.sent5: The stars shone brightly alongside the moon in the night sky.

meanings.definition: In conjunction or parallel with someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The two friends walked alongside each other in the park.
meanings.sent2: The train tracks run alongside the river for miles.
meanings.sent3: The cars on the highway moved alongside each other like colorful ants.
meanings.sent4: Their goals were aligned, running alongside each other towards success.
meanings.sent5: The melody of the two instruments played beautifully alongside one another.

meanings.definition: At the same time as someone or something.
meanings.sent1: She sang alongside the choir during the performance.
meanings.sent2: The thunder rumbled alongside the flashes of lightning in the storm.
meanings.sent3: The children laughed alongside the clucking of the chickens in the farmyard.
meanings.sent4: His heart raced alongside the beat of the drums at the concert.
meanings.sent5: The cheers of the crowd rose alongside the final whistle of the game.
